# Uniform Mesh Tutorials

## Setup (StackBlitz)

1. In Uniform, create a new project.

1. Create a new API key with access to Canvas.

1. Open [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/adamconn/mesh-tutorials?file=apps%2Fdemo-monsterpedia%2F.env)

1. After you open StackBlitz you will see an error in the terminal that environment variables are not set. You must set the variables in `apps\demo-monsterpedia\.env`.

1. This should automatically restart the container. If it doesn't, enter the following command in the terminal:
    ```
    npm run dev
    ```

1. In the Activity Bar (on the right-hand side), click the plug icon.

1. Two ports will be in use. Click on the port number to see the corresponding host name. You will need these host names to finish the configuration:
    * **4030** is the Uniform integration configuration app
    * **4040** is the demo site

1. In Uniform, navigate to **Settings > Canvas Settings**

1. Set the **Preview URL** to `https://github-######--4040.local.webcontainer.io/api/preview?secret=monster-secret`
    > The secret can be changed in `apps\demo-monsterpedia\.env`.

1. In Uniform, navigate to **Settings > Integrations**

1. Click **Create a new team integration**

1. Enter the following values:
    * Name: `Monsterpedia`

1. Enter the following for the field **Badge Icon Url**:
    ```
    data:image/svg+xml;base64,
    ```

1. Enter the following for the field **Badge Icon Url**:
    ```
    data:image/svg+xml;base64,
    ```

1. Enter the following for the field **Location Configuration**:
    ```json
    {
      "locations": {
        "canvas": {
          "parameterTypes": [
            {
              "type": "monster-list",
              "editorUrl": "/monster-list-parameter-editor",
              "displayName": "Monster List",
              "configureUrl": "/monster-list-parameter-config"
            }
          ]
        },
        "install": {
          "description": [
            "Monsterpedia is an encyclopedia of monsters. This integration enables you to include information about various monsters in your digital experiences."
          ]
        },
        "settings": {
          "url": "/settings"
        }
      },
      "baseLocationUrl": "https://github-######--4030.local.webcontainer.io"
    }
    ```

1. In Canvas, create a composition component with the following:
    * Parameter with the id **pageTitle**
    * Parameter with the id **featuredMonster**

1. In Canvas, create a composition with the following:
    * Slug: **/**

1. Now you can preview the site from Canvas.

## Setup (local)

1. Open a CLI to the root of repository.
1. Enter the following command:
    ```
    npm install
    ```
1. Set the variables in `apps\demo-monsterpedia\.env`

## Basic integration demo

The following web apps are used:

1. port `4030` - Mesh integration app
1. port `4040` - demo app

To start these apps in dev mode, run the following command on the CLI:

```
npm run dev
```

To build these apps, run the following command on the CLI:

```
npm run build
```
